body.p: To His Excellency the Governor of Kentucky: -

Your petitioner, Ellison Carter, States that he was recunnized in the Sum of one hundred dollars to appear in the Mercer Circuit Court at the April Term 1863, as a witness for plaintiff in the case of the Commonwealth against James Shackelford, Steven Trumans and William Faulkner. Your Petitioner further states that at said term of the Court his recognizance was forfeited, and that summons of said against him to appear at the October term, 1863, to Show cause why Judgment Should not be rendered against him on said forfeited recognizance, and that Judgment was rendered against him at said October term for said sum and costs.

Your Petitioner further states ^that^ in August, 1862, he enlisted as a Soldier in the services of the United States in the 9th Ky Calvary commanded by Col. R. T. Jacobs and in Capt H. ^I.^ Burns Company of said regiment. He also state at the April term, 1863, wher was reconized to appear as that he was absent in the of the United States, and is impossible for him to atten Court in accordance with his recognizance, which was thus forfeited while he was absent on duty with his

regiment. Petitioner further states that while at home in August, 1863, before being mustered out of the service process was served on him to appear at the following October term to show cause why judgment Should not be rendered agt. him, and that he was here ^present^ during said term of the court: but in his absence from the Court House, and being ignorant of the laws and what was required of him, Judgment went against him, of which he knew nothing till executive was issued therein with which he is now being processed. He asks your Excellency to remit said Judgment.
Ellison Carter states that the allegations in the foregoing petition are true.

Ellison ^his x mark^ Carter
Attest. Jno. G. Kyle.

Sworn to before me this 20 January
John G. Kyle P. J. H.
We the undersigned also petition Your Excellency to remit the Judgment against Ellison Carter.

John G. Kyle
Jno R Haggin
Tho C. Bell
Richard Board C. M. C. C
Thos Edwards P J M C C
J. W. Cardwell
O S Poston
Russel Naperall
Jas D S Gardire
H. G. Burns
C A Hardin
W. E. Riley

H. J. Burns States that he was Captain in Co. R. T. Jacobs regiment, 9 Ky. Calvary; that Ellison Carter was a member of his company, and that the statements of said Carter in his affidavit about him being absent in the Service of the U. S. Service at the time aforesaid are true

to before me this 21 January 1864.
John G. Kyle P. J. H.

Mercer Cir Ct
vs
Ellison Carter

Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
$100-
